personalInfo.name: Althaf Hussain Syed
personalInfo.title: DevOps Engineer | Cloud & Infrastructure Specialist
personalInfo.summary: Motivated DevOps Engineer with 3.5 years of experience supporting AWS cloud environments, CI/CD pipelines, and container-based deployments. Skilled in building automation, deployment support, and environment monitoring using Terraform, Jenkins, Docker, and Kubernetes. Works effectively with cross-functional teams and follows ITIL and SDLC practices to maintain stable and compliant operations. Focused on reliability, task ownership, and continuous improvement within enterprise infrastructure.
personalInfo.heroSummary: DevOps Engineer specializing in AWS cloud infrastructure, CI/CD automation, and container orchestration. Proven track record in building scalable pipelines and reducing manual effort by 70%. Certified across AWS, Azure, and Google Cloud platforms. Committed to operational excellence and continuous improvement.

experience.position: Analyst III Infrastructure Services | DevOps Engineer
experience.project: Cloud Platform Automation & Delivery | AWS Managed Services
achievements: Supporting automation, deployment, and environment operations in AWS Managed Services setup with CI/CD execution and environment monitoring
Maintained Jenkins pipelines and GitHub Actions for build, test, and deployment with Maven, SonarQube quality gates, and Docker image builds
Implemented end-to-end CI/CD automation, reducing manual effort by ~70% and improving delivery efficiency
Containerized applications using Docker and supported deployments in Kubernetes environments
Monitored system health and logs using CloudWatch, Grafana, Prometheus and Dynatrace
Managed incidents and change requests via ServiceNow, participating in daily stand-ups and CAB calls
Created and maintained Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs) and runbooks for CI/CD and monitoring tasks
Developed custom ServiceNow dashboard for incident tracking and SLA breach reporting
Received DXC CHAMPS Award (FY24 Q1) for consistent delivery and reliable execution of infrastructure operations
Received DXC CHAMPS Award (FY26 H1) for sustained performance and operational excellence

projects.title: Cloud-Native Microservices CI/CD Pipeline on AWS
projects.description: Architected and deployed a comprehensive CI/CD pipeline for microservices architecture on AWS, implementing containerization with Docker and orchestration with Kubernetes (EKS). The solution automated build, test, security scanning, and deployment workflows while ensuring zero-downtime deployments and comprehensive monitoring.
challenges: Designing scalable microservices architecture supporting 20+ services with independent deployment cycles
Implementing zero-downtime deployments using blue-green and canary strategies
Ensuring container security compliance with vulnerability scanning and policy enforcement
Managing infrastructure as code for consistent environment provisioning across dev, staging, and production
solutions: Built multi-stage Jenkins pipelines with parallel execution reducing build time by 60%
Implemented Helm charts for standardized Kubernetes deployments with version control
Integrated Trivy for container image scanning blocking deployments with critical vulnerabilities
Created Terraform modules for EKS cluster provisioning with auto-scaling and high availability
Configured Prometheus and Grafana for real-time monitoring with custom alerting rules
achievements: Reduced deployment time from 2 hours to 15 minutes through automation
Achieved 99.9% uptime with zero-downtime deployment strategies
Decreased infrastructure provisioning time by 70% using IaC
Identified and remediated 100+ security vulnerabilities through automated scanning

projects.title: AWS Infrastructure Automation with Terraform & Ansible
projects.description: Designed and implemented a complete Infrastructure as Code (IaC) solution using Terraform and Ansible to automate AWS infrastructure provisioning, configuration management, and application deployment. The solution enabled consistent, repeatable infrastructure deployments across multiple environments while reducing manual configuration errors and deployment time.
challenges: Managing complex multi-tier AWS infrastructure spanning VPC, compute, database, and storage resources
Ensuring consistent configuration across development, staging, and production environments
Implementing secure credential management and least-privilege access controls
Creating reusable, modular IaC templates to support multiple projects and teams
solutions: Developed reusable Terraform modules for VPC, EC2, RDS, S3, and IAM with parameterized configurations
Implemented Terraform remote state management using S3 with DynamoDB state locking for team collaboration
Created Ansible playbooks for application deployment, server hardening, and configuration drift detection
Built CI/CD pipeline integrating Terraform validation, planning, and automated approval workflows
Implemented AWS Secrets Manager for secure credential storage with Ansible dynamic inventory
achievements: Reduced infrastructure provisioning time from 3 days to 30 minutes
Eliminated 95% of manual configuration errors through automation
Enabled infrastructure version control and rollback capabilities
Decreased environment inconsistency issues by 80% through standardized templates
Automated security patching across 50+ EC2 instances reducing patch window from days to hours

projects.title: AWS CloudWatch & Grafana Monitoring Automation
projects.description: Engineered a comprehensive monitoring and observability platform integrating AWS CloudWatch, Prometheus, and Grafana to provide real-time visibility into application performance, infrastructure health, and business metrics. The solution automated alert management, incident response, and performance optimization across distributed microservices architecture.
challenges: Consolidating monitoring data from multiple AWS services and custom applications into unified dashboards
Reducing alert fatigue by implementing intelligent alerting with contextual threshold tuning
Enabling proactive issue detection before customer impact through predictive analytics
Creating cost-effective logging and metrics retention strategy for compliance requirements
solutions: Deployed Prometheus for metrics aggregation with custom exporters for application-specific KPIs
Built 15+ Grafana dashboards providing real-time visibility into CPU, memory, network, and application metrics
Implemented CloudWatch Logs Insights queries for automated log analysis and anomaly detection
Created Lambda functions for intelligent alert routing based on severity, time, and on-call schedules
Configured CloudWatch metric filters and alarms with dynamic threshold adjustment using AWS Lambda
Integrated SNS for multi-channel alerting (email, SMS, Slack) with escalation policies
achievements: Reduced mean time to detection (MTTD) by 75% through proactive monitoring
Decreased false positive alerts by 60% using intelligent threshold management
Improved incident response time by 50% with automated alert routing and runbook integration
Achieved 30% cost reduction in CloudWatch expenses through optimized log retention policies
Enabled data-driven capacity planning reducing over-provisioning by 40%
